quest.name: Returning Home
journal: Your excursion on the moon concluded, Y'shtola is keen to return to Etheirys.
objectives: Speak with Thancred at the Nethergate.
Speak with Lucia at Camp Broken Glass.
Speak with Krile at the Baldesion Annex.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: A declaration of hopes and aspirations... I hadn't thought of it that way before.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The Loporrits may be in good hands now, but that doesn't change the fact that their plan is a last resort I'd rather not employ.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Let's see it doesn't come to that. For the First and all the other reflections.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I need not remind you of the dangers we face, nor the countless lives at stake both in the Source and its reflections. Go with courage, my friend, and pray give the others my regards.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: I chanced to spy you crossing the chasm, and I feared something was amiss.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: But all is well, and more importantly, I have been given the opportunity to behold a wonderful sight.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Keep the Elpis close, and its light will be your guide.

dialogue.name: MAPPINGWAY
dialogue.text: There is little I can do to help stop the Final Days, but should you need to traverse the stars, look no further!

dialogue.name: MAPPINGWAY
dialogue.text: Such knowledge I can offer in abundance, so do not hesitate if you find yourself in need.

dialogue.name: SINGINGWAY
dialogue.text: The others will be so happy to hear Urianger is going to stay and teach us all about Etheirys.

dialogue.name: SINGINGWAY
dialogue.text: We'll have to be careful not to get too distracted by his lessons─there's still maintenance to carry out, after all.

dialogue.name: PUDDINGWAY
dialogue.text: Nice to meet you... Name's Puddingway.

dialogue.name: PUDDINGWAY
dialogue.text: Sorry again for all the trouble... We promise we'll do better. Honest.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Well, that was all rather embarrassing, wasn't it? At least we're on the same page now─people and Etheirys. We'll save both, or at least give it a good try.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Make sure everyone listens to Urianger, would you?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Tell Growingway I look forward to our next walk together.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You Loporrits sure are an excitable bunch.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Oh, we'll be all ears. And you know we can be!

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: I will. I'm sure he'll be glad to hear it.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Well, it's not as if we've been waiting twelve thousand years to meet the people of Etheirys. Oh wait, we have! But that's neither here nor there. Under Urianger's tutelage, we'll strive to become more hospitable hosts, and see that the moon is fully equipped to meet the needs of its potential passengers.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: With the Loporrits in Urianger's capable hands, we needn't worry about affairs here in our absence.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Knowing now the face of their “earthly collaborators,” there is much to discuss with Alphinaud and the others.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Let us return to the Tower of Babil. Our battle for the star will soon begin in earnest, and we must be prepared.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I'd forgotten how cold it was here in Garlemald. A testament to the Loporrits' ingenuity that I felt no such discomfort on the moon.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Gods, I can scarcely believe we went to the moon and back...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But we'll have time to reflect on that later. Right now, we need to head back to Camp Broken Glass and deliver a thoroughly detailed report to Lucia.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I'd like very much to know how everyone is getting on here as well. They'd only just begun to treat the tempered prisoners when we left.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I share your curiosity, but warning our allies of the Final Days is of greater importance.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I speak not only of the contingent, of course. The heads of state of every nation must know what we have learned.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We know not when or where or in what manner the Final Days will begin to manifest, and so we must see that everyone is prepared.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Agreed, though we may wish to stress the importance of discretion, lest the public be sent into a panic. Not that anyone in a position of responsibility should need to be told as much, but it bears repeating.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Anyway, first things first. To Camp Broken Glass.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Forename? At last, you are returned!

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: It's good to see you all again. No worse for your lunar adventure, I hope.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We've done what we can for now, and believe me, we intend to tell you all about it.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But before we do, might you tell us what's become of Garlemald in our absence?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: We succeeded in subduing the tempered inside the Tower of Babil. We took many alive, but combined with those who were already in our custody, the number requiring care has grown exponentially.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: The inclement conditions here have made it difficult─if not impossible─to treat them all here, and so we have petitioned the aid of the allied nations.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Some are, understandably, hesitant to proffer assistance, particularly those that were but recently subject to imperial occupation. That said, several others have agreed to grant them refuge for treatment.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: With the assistance of your fellow Scions, we endeavor to see them safely transported and subsequently cured of their tempering.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Will all the tempered be relocated?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Not all, no. We have sufficient shelter to attend to those whose treatment has begun, and enough healers have volunteered to remain until their patients have recovered.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Jullus is one such patient, though he is not yet fit to receive visitors.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Truth be told, it was a miracle he and those in his company were not harmed in the chaos. If not for Alphinaud and Alisaie's timely assistance, I daresay none of them would be with us today.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: In light of recent developments, have the Alliance leaders come to any decisions regarding Garlemald?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Given the tremendous ramifications of what has happened here, it will take time to determine what must be done. In the meantime, they intend to work with the Eastern alliance to keep a close watch over the provinces.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: We have other news to share: shortly after Anima was defeated, we received reports that each and every tower has vanished.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: For a mercy, the process was apparently not quite as violent as that you experienced in Thavnair. Those who were trapped within them have been rescued and are receiving treatment. To hasten this endeavor, the beast tribes have received instruction in the magicks needed to cure tempering.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Master Matoya is no doubt thrilled the mother porxie affords her so many visitors.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Yes, we are grateful for her ongoing efforts, as well of those of our comrades near and far.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: As for the contingent, several of our members have been granted leave to return to their homelands after the transfer of tempered has been completed.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Lucia and I will remain, along with a small force to continue offering aid to those here in Garlemald.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: The Empire may be no more, but there are yet those who call these lands home.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: I believe that accounts for recent events here. So─what of the moon and the Telophoroi?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: The Final Days... Gods, I prayed your victory would mark the end of our troubles.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: There is still much we do not know, but the Alliance leaders must be told. Would you be willing to contact them in our stead?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Yes, of course. I will send word forthwith.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: We'll also release your fellow Scions from their present duties, that they may return to Sharlayan.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Your energies are better spent finding a means to avert the coming apocalypse.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Speaking of your fellow Scions, you will be happy to hear that Mistress Krile, though still on the mend, has been moved to the Baldesion Annex and given into Tataru's care.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Thank you. I look forward to seeing them both upon our return.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Let us be on our way, then.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: One last thing, if I may.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: After your confrontation with Zodiark, you said Zenos took his leave, and in all likelihood he has returned here to Garlemald.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: I have a mind to dispatch scouts to try and ascertain his whereabouts, but first wished to ask if you believe there is merit in doing so.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: If they found him, they would not likely live to tell the tale.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: If you're expecting a trail of destruction to follow, you won't find one.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: An admirable but futile endeavor.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: <sigh> I suppose you're right...

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: To dispatch good soldiers in pursuit of such a beast...would be to send them to their deaths.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Aye. You are the only foe he considers worthy.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: And even if my men found him, who but you could even hope to bring low that monster?

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Mayhap you're right...

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: And I suppose if anyone is to hunt him down, it must be you. Who else could even hope to bring low that monster?

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Pray forget I entertained the notion.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: While on the subject of Zenos, the Xth Legion has made an official proclamation.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: They denounce the crown prince and condemn his role in the Empire's downfall.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: His very title has become a source of shame among his former subjects, and its continued use serves only to hinder relations with foreign nations.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: For this reason, he has been declared as Zenos viator Galvus, outcast and enemy of Garlemald.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Fandaniel is no more, and now his own people turn against him. It seems he's naught but his bloodlust to keep him company.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Better that than an army to see it sated. At any rate, I will not keep you longer. I pray you safe passage back to Sharlayan.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Your findings will be relayed to the Alliance leaders word for word. And should we spy anything out of the ordinary here in Garlemald, all shall be informed at once.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Once my countrymen have recovered, it falls to me to tell them what's become of Zenos and the Empire.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: I realize there is no kindness in withholding the truth, but...it will wound them.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Oh, it's so good to see you! And free from chilblains, I take it?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: You'll be pleased to know everything's been kept in order since you've been away. I even brought a few useful knickknacks with me from back home.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: But no sooner had they arrived than I received word of Krile in poor health, and you on the moon! If you meant to give me a fright, you succeeded.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. We were so terribly worried about you.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Though it is plain I have caused my own fair share of worry, and for that, I apologize.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Hydaelyn called to me that day when you entered the Tower of Babil. Her pleas were faint but desperate, and I knew at once She required a vessel to carry out Her will.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: What came after feels like a dream barely remembered. My body flowing through the Lifestream toward Garlemald...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: When I regained consciousness, I was all aches and frostbite, exhausted of aether. So exhausted, in fact, I could only laugh, for it was in that moment I understood Raha's weariness from the Tower of Zot.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Would that I could laugh at a time like this. Though we prevented Zodiark from being unleashed upon the world, I am curious to know what else took place there on the moon...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Ah, perhaps we should wait for the others to join us before you give your account.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Let us reconvene in the main hall once they've arrived.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: For a blessing, I've recovered enough to get out of bed. Even if I hadn't, I could not well miss you recount your exploits on the moon.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Wait for your comrades to arrive?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Sorry to have kept you all waiting.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Not at all. We understand you've been quite busy.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Will Urianger be joining us?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Duty keeps him away, I'm afraid, though Forename can explain why better than I.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Final Days...as befell Amaurot.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: And we are to escape via the moon? What of the Source and its reflections?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I've no intention of standing by while the world falls to ruin.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: So, how do we stop this?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, we have no answers at present.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If the celestial currents have grown stagnant, as was the case in the time of Amaurot, the solution would be to alter the flow of aether throughout the entirety of the star.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The ancients accomplished this by summoning Zodiark, sacrificing half the star's population in the doing. But it should go without saying that such a sacrifice must not─cannot─be repeated.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Which leaves us with the daunting task of identifying the underlying catalyst for the Final Days, a feat which even the Amaurotines could not accomplish.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, we found no clues in Mare Lamentorum.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: There is still much we do not know about the catastrophe itself, let alone what may have caused it.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Final Days were marked by the corruption of the Amaurotines' creation magicks, but we command no such power. Which invites the question: what havoc is in store for us?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If we knew that much, perhaps we could draw some parallel with the events of the past, and thereby form some semblance of a plan.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Perhaps we should start with the Forum, then. Having worked with the Loporrits in secret all this time, there is surely more they can tell us.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Forgive the interruption, but I've urgent news!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: The Forum is holding a public assembly in the plaza outside. Some sort of announcement!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What is Father up to now?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: There's only one way to find out.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Krile tells me the Forum made a rather momentous announcement. So there's to be a great exodus, is there?

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: I'm reminded of my narrow escape from the Isle of Val. The realization, the running, the mixture of relief and regret after. “Why me?” I asked myself. “Why me?”

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Why us? Why now? Why wonder─there's no use fretting over the cosmic morality or lack thereof. We're here, and we'll get through this together. And who knows, maybe my luck will rub off and grant everyone a narrow escape. There's no harm in praying for as much.

dialogue.name: OJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Oh, but enough of my rambling─I'm sure you're exhausted. Your chamber awaits!

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Retire to your chamber?
